question: The world’s first CNG port terminal is to be opened in which city?
explanation: A compressed natural gas (CNG) terminal will be opened at Bhavnagar with a proposed investment of ₹1,900 crore. It the world’s first CNG port terminal. It will be developed jointly by U.K.-headquartered Foresight Group and Mumbai-based Padmanabh Mafatlal Group. The proposed CNG terminal will have annual capacity of 1.5 metric tonnes. At present, the Bhavnagar port is operated by Gujarat Maritime Board, which is handling three metric tonnes of cargo annually.
